channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: India’s app downloads rebounded to 25.5 billion in 2025, fueled by AI assistants and microdrama boom
item.description: ChatGPT was the second most downloaded app in India for 2025 after Instagram.

item.title: Language learning marketplace Preply’s unicorn status embodies Ukrainian resilience
item.description: Language learning marketplace Preply is now valued at $1.2 billion after raising a $150 million that marks a new chapter for the 14-year-old company.

item.title: Snap reaches settlement in social media addiction lawsuit
item.description: Snap is still a defendant in similar cases related to social media addiction.

item.title: Consumers spent more on mobile apps than games in 2025, driven by AI app adoption
item.description: Consumers spent more money in mobile apps than games in 2025, driven by AI app adoption.

item.title: Amagi slides in India debut, as cloud TV software firm tests investor appetite
item.description: Amagi shares debuted at a 12% discount, offering an early read on investor demand for a rare type of tech listing in India.

item.title: Trump administration admits DOGE may have misused Americans’ Social Security data
item.description: The revelation comes as part of a series of corrections in a legal case over DOGE’s access to Social Security Administration data.

item.title: Luminar founder Austin Russell agrees to accept subpoena in bankruptcy case
item.description: The agreement comes two weeks after Luminar accused its billionaire founder of dodging information requests, as it evaluates potential legal claims.

item.title: Why Serve Robotics is acquiring a hospital assistant robot company
item.description: Serve Robotics is expanding beyond its sidewalk delivery roots by acquiring Diligent Robotics, which makes a hospital assistant bot named Moxi.

item.title: UStrive security lapse exposed personal data of its users, including children
item.description: The online mentoring site UStrive exposed email addresses, phone numbers, and other non-public information to other logged-in users. The nonprofit tol...

item.title: X open sources its algorithm while facing a transparency fine and Grok controversies
item.description: In a post to Github on Tuesday, the social media giant purported to share its secret sauce.
